name: NewYorker
text: “[The police] weren’t waiting for anything,” an activist said, of a recent protest in New York City. “They were aggressive from the very beginning.” https://t.co/afquXX1uly

name: NewYorker
text: Bolinas, California, a tiny hippie enclave north of San Francisco, has mounted one of the most advanced coronavirus-testing efforts in America. How did the town end up at the forefront of pandemic strategy? https://t.co/ve4ig1DYJx

name: NewYorker
text: “Perhaps we were, all of us . . . bound together by the nature of our oppression,” James Baldwin wrote, of growing up in Harlem. "If so, within these limits we sometimes achieved with each other a freedom that was close to love.” https://t.co/8OVFAT6gsB

name: NewYorker
text: "Even now, after all that the country has endured in the past three and a half years, there are moments when it can feel as if we are wandering through a farce so bleak and implausible that it tests the mind," @eosnos writes. https://t.co/dBcoimZwsy

name: NewYorker
text: Over the course of the past week, William Barr, more than any other member of Donald Trump’s Cabinet, fulsomely defended a President whose response to the demonstrations is being harshly criticized by current and former Administration officials. https://t.co/HjIotDYRXX
